Subject: Review of Categorization of Districts affected by Left Wing
Extremism
Dear Sirs,
As you are aware. 'National Policy and Action Plan to Address Left Wing
Extremism (LWE)', approved in 2015, is beirrg implemented to combat LWE
holistically. The Central and the State Governments have been working closely to
tackle this problem. A number of interventions are being made, botlr security and
development related, as a result of which, there has been a marked impt'ovement
in the LWE scenario.
2. 
The categorization of districts provides the basis for deployment of resources
under various schemes. The evolving LWE situation necessitates a periodic review
of tlre diskicts in order to ensure tlrat the focus of anti-LWE efforts remains aligned
to the ground realities.
3. 
The districts covered under the Security Related Expenditure (SRE) Scheme
were last revised in 2021. After the review 70 districts were included in as SRE
distrlcts. Of these 25 were categorized as the 'Most Affected Distrlcts' while 08 were
categorized as Districts of Concern (DOC). 01 district was reorganized by
Chhattisgarh into 03 districts in 2022, thereby the efiectrve number of SRE districts
ate 72.
4. 
A comprehensive review has again been undertaken in consultation with the
States. During the review, 16 existing SRE Scheme districts have been excluded
and 02 new districts have been added. As a result, of these changes, the number
of SRE districts has come down from 72 in 10 States to 58 in 10 states.

continuing.
As a subset of this category, 12 districts are categorized as Most Affected
Districts. The category of N/lost Affected Districts was created in 2015 with
35 districts to ensure focused deployment of resources. Subsequently'
following a review in 2018, the numlrer of districts was brought down to 30
arrd thereafter to 25 in 2021 .
As another subset of LWE affected districts, 'Districts of Concern (DOC)'was

23. All of the 08 districts have been excluded from the list of DOCs and 09

(b) The 'Legacy' districts are the districts which are no more LWE affected but
